item.description:
The venerable Ms. Eiliesh Tuffy will be our Nov. discussion leader! 

 Book: Slaughterhouse Five, by Kurt Vonnegut

Time: 7:00 PM         Date: Wed., Nov. 16

Place: Diesel Cafe, Somerville:  We have a large table reserved in the back of the cafe!

Background 4-1-1:

Kurt Vonnegut, Jr., was born on November 11, 1922, in Indianapolis, Indiana. His father was a prominent, MIT-trained architect and his mother was the daughter of a wealthy brewer. They were liberal, atheistic, and well-to-do third-generation Germans who were prominent in the social scene of their city.

In 1969, Kurt Vonnegut, Jr., was not especially well known or commercially successful, despite having already published five novels and two short story collections. The publication of Slaughterhouse-Five in that year marked Vonnegut's artistic and commercial breakthrough. Based on Vonnegut's own experiences as a World War II prisoner who witnessed the Feb. 1945 Allied firebombing of Dresden, Germany, Slaughterhouse-Five is the story of Billy Pilgrim, a man who has come ‘‘unstuck in time.’’

-- Only Vonnegut can take what was a catastrophic event and put a humorous, other-worldy spin on it. While the topic may sound dreary, Vonnegut's "out-of-body" description from inside the bunker reads like an entirely different story at times, wholly detached from the outside world.
item.name: Cambridge Book Club Readers: Vonnegut's Slaughterhouse Five
